definition: lit. spring wind and rain (idiom); fig. the long-term influence of a solid education
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: Wordless help is as spring wind turns clouds into rain.
sentences.chinese: 无言的帮助如春风化雨。

definition: instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom)/fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop/cf. 十年樹木，百年樹人|十年树木，百年树人
lit. to anoint your head with the purest cream (idiom); fig. to enlighten people with perfect wisdom/flawless Buddhist teaching
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom). A good education program takes a long time to develop.
pinyin: shi2 nian2 shu4 mu4 , bai3 nian2 shu4 ren2

definition: to teach by words and example (idiom)
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
